728428f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Johnson Avenue
728428f-a.text:
Arthur Eill Road, south side, at Johnson Avenue (or Shore
Road), showing the statue made by the Clay Club in an old clay
pit.
June 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
728428f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Johnson Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729051f-a.title: Richmond: Johnson Avenue - Arthur Kill Road
729051f-a.text:
(1)
Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road), west side, abeut 700 yards
north of Arthur Kill Road and 150 yards south of the shore of
Arthur Kill, showing the Johnson (Johnston) House (1853-1874).
In 1898 it belonged to G.C. Graves, and in 1907 to Louise M.
Giegerioh. In 1917 it was the property of Chas. W. Graves. The
dates refer to maps on which the owners' names appear. The view
is southwestward.
October 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the house in a northeasterly direction. Johnson
Ave. runs north from Arthur Kill Road to Arthur Kill midway
between Ellis Road and Ohemical Lane.
June 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
729051f-a.folder: Johnson Avenue & Arthur Kill Road, Staten Island, NY

729051f-b.text:

728429f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Johnson Avenue
728429f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, 200 yards east of Johnson Ave.
(or Shore Road). The house is attuated 800 yards back of Arthur Kill
Road, on the shore of Arthur Kill. In 1874 it was located on property
belonging to J. Woglaa. and from 1898 to 1917 the property belonged to
the International Ultramarine Works. The dates refer to maps on which
the property owners' names appear.
June 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
728429f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Johnson Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729050f-a.title: Richmond: Johnson Avenue - Arthur Kill Road
729050f-a.text:
(1)
JJdhunson Ave. (or Shore Road), west side, about 700 yards north
of Arthur Kill Road and 150 yards south of the shore of Arthur Kill,
showing the Johnson (Johnston) House (1853-1874). In 1898 it be-
longed to 0. C. Graves, and in 1907 to Louise M. Giegerich. In 1917
it was the property of Chas. W. Graves. The dates refer to maps on
which the owners' names appear.
November 25, 1922.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A full front view of the house.
November 25, 1922.
P. L. Sperr.

729052f-a.title: Richmond: Johnson Avenue - Arthur Kill Road
729052f-a.text:
Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road), north from a point midway between
Arthur Kill Road and the shore of Arthur Kill, showing an old railroad
track running beside the International Ultramarine Works. Johnson Ave.
Fruns north from Arthur Kill Road to Arthur Kill, midway between Ellis
Road and Chemical Lane.
October 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

728427f-b.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Johnson Avenue
728427f-b.text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, south side, at Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road).
The view shows members ofCClay Club and a monument of Staten Island
clay constructed in an old clay pit near the abandoned railroad
tracks of the International Ultramarine Works.
June 17, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A more distant view of the monument.
June 17, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Members of the Clay Club at work on the monument.
June 17, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

729054f-a.title: Richmond: Johnson Avenue - Arthur Kill Road
729054f-a.text:
Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road), east side, 400 yards north of
Arthur Kill Road, showing the International Ultramarine Works. Th
buildings are situated near the shore of Arthur Kill. The view i
northward. Johnson Ave. runs north from Arthur Kill Road to Arth
Kill, midway between Ellis Road and Chemioal Lane.
October 6, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
729054f-a.folder: Johnson Avenue & Arthur Kill Road, Staten Island, NY

729053f-a.title: Richmond: Johnson Avenue - Arthur Kill Road
729053f-a.text:
Johnson Ave. (or Shore Road), east side, about 600 yards north
of Arthur Kill Road. The view shows a pond near the International
Ultremarine Works. Johnson Ave. runs north from Arthur Kill Road to
Arthur Kill, midway between Ellis Road and Chemical Lane.
October 6, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

729049f-a.title: Richmond: Johnson Avenue - Arthur Kill Road
729049f-a.text:

Ellis Street, showing the Tottenville Hat Works.
April 23, 1929
P. L. Sperr,
NO RFPRODUCTIONS.
